title: Solo Snoooker Practices by Shahram Changezi Pakistan

json.text: There are many solo practices which can help you enhance your game and can take it to a much professional level
Basic solo practice is this line of balls
behind black some reds, between black and pink some reds and the rest between pink and blue
[STAGE 1] you need to clear all the reds with either black, blue or pink
You can pot with any color but you need to do clearance with 15 reds
[STAGE 2] You need to try for 147 in the same setting (pot black with every red) and clearance
[STAGE 3] In the same setting, pot 15 reds with any color
you can make break of 135 or 140
but try to place the cue ball in this area and continue break.
Once lineup is finished then place the reds again in the same line and go for a break of 1000, 1500 or 2000
This will check your stamina and during match you won't have pressure of break building
This practice will also help you to control exertion during match
This is actually stamina building practice
You need to place reds in a zig-zag form
at first try to pot all the reds with different colors and focus on clearance
then try to go for 147 by potting every red with black
This practice is quite difficult and is considered as an advanced level practice
It is advisable that you make yourself perfect with the first 3 practices explained and then try this one
This is another solo practice, we can call it cross or 'X'
This is typical solo practice for 147
in this practice you can place the reds closer to each other or wider
its totally up to you, but they will remain in cross form
You have to go for 147, there is no other option in this typical practice
After Zig-Zag this practice is a lot difficult
it might look easy but it is quite difficult, you will feel it when you try
Now this practice is between two center pockets place 10 reds on sides of blue
both red and blue will be pot in corner pocket
after this practice you will be so perfect in potting blue in corner pocket
that you will never miss blue again
In this practice we have 2 reds by the sides of every color ball
you need to pot all the reds along the color which is between the two reds
e.g. when you pot the red by the side of yellow, then after potting red you need to pot yellow
first red then yellow, second red then yellow, third red then brown and so on
try to finish this practice in sequence of yellow, green, brown, blue, pink and black.
remember if you are potting reds by the side of blue you need to pot blue with it.
after all these practices this practice will move you around the whole table
first pot yellow and then black, after black pot green...
and then again black, then brwon and then black and so on
in other words just follow the color sequence while potting black with every color, this practice will make you move around the whole table.
You will have very good control all around the table
